text.front:
arXiv:cond-mat/0402638v1 [cond-mat.supr-con]
26 Feb 2004
Proton incorporations and superconductivity
in a cobalt oxyhydrate
Guanghan Cao a, * , Xiaoming Tang b , Yi Xu a , Ming Zhong a ,
Xuezhi Chen a , Chunmu Feng b , and Zhu'an Xu a
a Department of Physics, Zhejiang University,
Hangzhou, Zhejiang 310027,
People's Republic of China
b Test and Analysis Center, Zhejiang University,
Hangzhou, Zhejiang 310027,
People's Republic of China
Abstract
We report the evidence of proton incorporations in a newly-discovered cobalt oxy-
hydrate superconductor. During the hydration process for Na 0.32 CoO 2 by the direct
reaction with water liquid, it was shown that substantial NaOH was gradually lib-
erated, indicating that H + is incorporated into the hydrated compound. Combined
with the thermogravimetric analysis, the chemical composition of the typical sample
is Na 0.22 H 0.1 CoO 2 â€¢ 0.85H 2 O, which shows bulk superconductivity at 4.4 K.
Key words:
PACS: 74.62.Bf; 74.70.-b;74.10.+v
A. Superconductors, C. Thermogravimetric analysis; C. X-ray diffraction
* Corresponding author
Email address: ghcao@zju.edu.cn
(Guanghan Cao).
Preprint submitted to Elsevier Science
24 August 2018
